review_title: Great experience but at minimum wage
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: Undergraduate research assistants work part-time as a work-study job at Smith College. I've gotten to do graduate-level research with a tenured professor. We (myself, other researchers, and my professor) have presented our work at three conferences and are currently submitting papers for publishing.
cons: All work-study jobs are minimum wage at Smith.

job_title: Work Study Student in Northampton, MA
pros: Highly diverse range of jobs.
cons: Northampton is very expensive! Work study is paid at minimum wage.

pros: Low stress job, time to work on homework during shift
cons: I have no complaints about it

pros: Fabulous benefits, great sense of comradery among the team, beautiful campus and facilities
cons: no cons to report at this time

pros: the town, the students, most colleagues
cons: supervisor was weak and petty.

pros: Easy to swap shifts, stays busy
cons: Lunch rushes can be crazy, you will get messy

pros:
Nice coworkers
Lots of vacation and sick paid day offs
cons: Low wages and different wages for similar positions

pros: 35 hour work week is amazing
cons: Lots of opinions to listen to

pros: Work environment can be good
cons: Management is not the best

job_title: Physics Learning Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: The people are extremely kind, considerate, and want you to learn and get the most out of your experience.
cons: I was working as a student which made some of the hours difficult to maintain.

pros: Like many university positions the academic work is exciting and the work culture is welcoming
cons: The structure of your work schedule is very dependent on the principal investigator you work with.

review_title: Good Place to Live and Work
job_title: Applications Systems Analyst in Northampton, MA
pros:
- Northampton is a good town to live and work. 
- Good team work environment. 
- Opportunities to learn skills.
cons:
- Salary could be higher. 
- Projects can take a very long and slow process.

pros:
-Flexibility
-Control over your schedule
cons: -Can be not dependable based on you hours

pros: There is more flexibility - and was able to telework
cons: Hours are not always reliable - depends on student need

pros: Its only been a few months, people are very nice
cons: Faculty seem very burned out

pros: convenient to be on campus
cons: minimum wage only, dining services overwhelmed

pros: It's easy to get a job in a lab as a Smith student
cons: You don't get paid more than minimum wage

pros:
Benefits
Students and faculty 
Beautiful campus
cons: Northampton is a college town.

pros: Salary is pretty good for a student job
cons: Long hours sometime with rush

pros: Solid, well-endowed institution with benefits. But many have been eliminated with Covid and no certainty to ever be restored.
cons: Entitlement. Surrounded by wealth, paid poorly. Watching capital investment everywhere on campus while staff received no raises in 2 years. To add insult, they increase charges to employees without providing pay increases.

job_title: Elementary Teacher in New York, NY
pros: the school is in proximity to my house
cons: the student body is small but nice

pros: The Smith students and very good. They do their work and are interested in learning. Good peers. Very nice working conditions. For adjunct work, good pay.
cons: While the adjuncts are treated very well by department heads, they are not treated well by the head of school.

pros: Helpful, friendly, great museum collection, flexible team
cons: Very bureaucratic, quite white, slightly untransformed

pros: Very kind people, I would recommend to anyone
cons: Tough shift times sometimes, but still flexible

pros:
- True sense of communal learning
- Accomplished professors
- Great learning experience
cons:
- Social justice tensions can sometimes take over in nonproductive ways
- Minimum wage

pros: Good place to lifeguard, nice facility
cons: None, a good student job

pros: Kind and respectful colleagues and good work environment.
cons: The area is overwhelmed with overqualified pros, so salaries stay low in general.

pros: Awesome management and employees nice
cons: Only thing is being forced when there are call outs

review_title: Excellent benefits package, staff salaries could be better
pros: Comprehensive health, dental, vision plans. Great retirement planning and contributions. Tuition reimbursement for graduate and undergraduate degree programs.
cons: Difficult to negotiate for wages.

job_title: Senior Prospect Researcher in Northampton, MA
pros: Promotes work life balance well
cons: There have been no downsides encountered yet

pros: Nothing specific related to the position itself but beautiful campus
cons: Low pay and no opportunities for career advancement

pros: Great company to work for all around
cons: Absolutely no cons at all glassdoor

review_title: wonderful staff and great learning opportunity!
pros:
* The Lazarus Center is a great work study job. I mostly give feedback on student cover letters and resumes, which has helped me tremendously with my own application process.
* Very kind and knowledgeable staff
cons: * limited hours due to work study

review_title: Fun to work at Design Thinking Initiative
job_title: Maker Space Mentor in Northampton, MA
pros: I've loved my work at the Design Thinking Initiative under Emily. The space is vibrant, and they're always looking for feedback from student workers to improve things. I also get to use neat equipment and teach other people about how it's used!
cons: College hiring processes can be a touch arcane.

pros: I get to design and implement my research of choice
cons: Compensation is very little. No benefits. Hourly wage.

review_title: Excellent Opportunty for experience for Inexperienced Worker
pros: interesting work; good managers; great environment
cons: No cons. Better job than I could have gotten anywhere else in the world. I literally had no work experience and they took me and trained me

pros: Environment that is committed to furthering diversity and promoting student well being.
cons: At times you have to deal with massive amounts of student entitlement.

pros: great benefits including tuition reimbursement
cons: small raises year after year

job_title: Stay At Home Mom in Boston, MA
pros: Beautiful campus, supportive environment, kind co-workers
cons: Typical temp job cons: moving offices around, tedious admin work

pros: teaching experience, leadership opportunity, content
cons: might take some time and needs flexibility

review_title: Stay for the students, leave because of the administration
pros: Students are hard working and great to teach. Starting salary and course load for full-time lecturers is better than many other full-time lecturer positions.
cons: Contingent faculty are not treated well or respected by the administration or tenured faculty.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: very understanding supervisors, nice work environment, clear instructions
cons: as a first year, I didn't get to choose my time slots

pros: Supportive, flexible, growth, opportunities, pragmatic
cons: remote, short, term, position, new

pros: Nice professor and students to work with
cons: can't really think of any cons

review_title: Excellent standards and conditions for student employees.
pros: Flexible hours and accommodating supervisors
cons: Pays state minimum wage, which is too little for some on-campus jobs

job_title: Peer Writing Tutor in Northampton, MA
pros: flexibility, support, kind people, great training
cons: late hours, sometimes students take advantage of tutors or are rude

pros: beautiful campus, other departments seem much more functional
cons: dysfunctional department, other departments better

review_title: It's a friendly place to work and people are nice.
pros:
1. Northampton is a lovely town.
2. The campus is beautiful.
3. Students are young, smart, energetic, it makes you feel that way, too.
4. Summer time's workload is low since students' are gone, but summer time is the best time in NE, you will get lots of quality time with yourself and your family/friends.
5. You work in a school, it's convenient for you to get education / development on-site.
cons:
1. Salary is not attracting (it's academia, can't complain)
2. Too many women around, sometimes has to do men's job such as heavy-lifting
3. Not many men's restrooms around the campus
It's a lovely place, I can't think of any other cons.

pros: Amazing place- progressive hr policies and benefits- unbelievable pension, time off, training opportunities. Good work life balance and great for working parents
cons: You get hooked on this place and it's hard to leave even if it would be good for your career.  Some complainers among long term people here but most recognize it as best employer in the state

pros: I worked as a student library assistant at both the Young Science and Neilson Libraries. Great team work, friendly staff, good pay.
cons: I worked as a student library assistant at both the Young Science and Neilson Libraries. Some of the staff can be hard on the student workers. Minimum wage pay

pros: Many opportunities to learn software, practice with problem solving, and develop generic working skills such as collaboration, troubleshooting, and advancing skills through provided resources.
cons: The work gets repetitive, but it is because the professors are not trained in the technology used. I wished there was a more structured way of learning new software, such as training and workshops.

pros: Worked as a student worker in the IT department for three years, great job. Can do homework or play games when just sitting around to wait for help calls to come in.
cons: Training was a bit spotty when I was trained and the managers had a lot of turnover thr last year. I think training has improved since then though.

pros: Smith College's work study programs provide students with the skills they need to be effective in the job market, including using computer programs and interacting with others in a professional manner. Smith has a LGBTQ-friendly environment with lots of great people.
cons: Federal work study pays only minimum wage, even though under the federal program they could technically pay more. College actively discourages collective bargaining for full time dining staff.

pros: Great staff. When I was a student there the catering department was the best place to work. Students were able to access the best food and we also learned some tangible skills. They also made sure to keep the best student workers happy to make sure they come back.
cons: Hours can be long, especially after large events

job_title: Theater Faculty Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: I've held 3 different work study jobs at Smith College and all have been very positive experiences.  Supervisors are helpful and understanding.
cons: There are no real downsides but if I had to pick sometimes it can be hard to pick up enough hours

review_title: Lewis Global Studies Center Office Assistant
pros: Good place to work! If you work in the mornings, free espresso/lattes/etc. You end up knowing a lot about what's going on on campus in terms of events because you do publicity.
cons: Not much to complain about, honestly. Regular trials and tribulations of a desk job where "customer" service is a big portion of the responsibility.

pros: An educational and intriguing place to work, where you can greatly improve your sewing and design skills while simultaneously having fun and getting a chance to be part of show production.
cons: Minimum wage pay and kind of a small space that can get a bit cramped (but full of good stuff!)

review_title: Great place to work - depending on who you work for.
pros: Smith offers great benefits and it is in a wonderful location
cons: Pay scale seems a bit low, even for W. Mass.  There have been times my boss (independent grant funded researcher) was told she couldn't give me the raise she wanted to because it was against college policy.

job_title: Part-time Campus Tour Guide in Northampton, MA
pros: The people are very friendly and willing to teach you whatever it takes to do the job
cons: Sometime working pace can be really slow and if you're conducting campus tours there might be no one showing up. Or sometimes there're too many people scheduled to give the same tours.

pros: Diversity of work and people I work with. Pleasant work environment with little or no stress.
cons: Hard to get pay increased as job description doesn't match mainstream for comparison.

pros: great atmosphere, never a dull moment (in a good way), always something to learn
cons: no growth opportunities, barely any pay (but it's work study, so what can you say)

pros: It was a great job to have a college student. It was actually interesting--not mindless at all-- and the pay was good for campus jobs. I liked my coworkers.
cons: None, really. I lucked out when I got this job.

pros: Work with students; rewarding community engagement programs and centers; good benefits.
cons: Conservative institutional culture; resistant to change and steeped in tradition. If you're looking for something fast-paced this isn't the place for you.

job_title: Chem Lab TA in Northampton, MA
pros: Awesome experience!! I learned a lot about the subject and it was really helpful learning how to run a lab with a highly skilled professor
cons: long labs, but not necessarily a lot of tedious work!

pros: Some of the people are nice.
cons: Some of the people are not so nice, and the workload is unbelieveable.

job_title: Program Coordinator in Mountain View, CA
pros: Grea location, and good cost of living.  I was in a really good department, that cared about the community
cons: Some departments don't do so well and they have a revolving door of employees

review_title: Most of all, a good atmosphere
job_title: Smith Fund Phonathon Caller in Northampton, MA
pros:
People and working environment are nice and pleasant
Flexible schedules for part-time workers
cons: If you want creativity, not the best place as most things are by-the-book where I was working

pros: Great work environment filled with friendly people and a collegiate atmosphere.
cons: Low pay, no benefits, very few hours.

job_title: Assistant Foil Coach in Northampton, MA
pros: Great HR, competitive pay, good benefits, lovely co-workers
cons: Hard to break in if you don't have someone already working there to recommend you.

pros: Very supportive team, lots of training, great learning opportunities, and incredible sense of community. Would take on this learning experience again.
cons: Poor work-life balance. Difficult to set boundaries.

pros: Great nurturing environment, faculty and staff really care about you, tight knit community
cons: It is a bubble here

pros:
Was able to balance school and working
Developed great connections with dining and staff employees
cons: Limited to only 10 hours a week as a first year

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Northampton, MA
pros: Supportive faculty, many opportunities to learn and grow as a scientist.
cons: It's a small liberal arts college.

pros: A wonderful environment in which to meet new people! Great leadership.
cons: Student employees only get free food unless they are working during lunch/dinner shifts.

pros: You work with people who genuinely care about their careers, great benefits
cons: Not enough interdepartmental communication, especially between faculty and staff.

pros: All women. Beautiful campus. Diversified environment. Wonderful students.
cons: Weather is too sever. Transportation is not very convenient.

pros: Very caring community. Lots of training and support.
cons: Harder for some students to find support.

pros: This is a lovely place to work - everyone is so nice, and relatively lowkey job
cons: I have loved working here

pros: clean, good food, experienced staff
cons: huge learning curve, union can be difficult to maneuver but are very helpful and nice

review_title: Plenty of changes to receive  a little pocketmoney

Understanding staff
Opportunities for responsible positions
cons: No incentives for improvement once having taken a job.

pros: Flexible job options; independence.
cons: Inflexible hours sometimes; sporadic hours.  Not allowed to work over 12 hours per week.
